DataElement.preferredName: Additional Tumor Tissue Biospecimen Standard Operating Procedure Process Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates whether additional tumor tissue biospecimens were processed according to the BPV standard operating procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Additional Tumor Tissue Biospecimen Standard Operating Procedure Process
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further._A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation._A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further.:A tumor sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.:A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

Concepts.definition: An established procedure to be followed in carrying out a given operation or in a given situation.
A sequence of events which produces some outcome.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
